Subjective: Dizziness for 3 days. Worsens with head movement. No fever, no headache, no nausea, no vomiting, no pain, no hearing loss, no speech difficulties, no loss of function. Worried about brain tumour. Scared of dizziness. Unable to play tennis due to fatigue. No smoking, no alcohol, no drugs.
Objective: BP: 110/70. Pulse: 62/min. Normal neurological examination. No nystagmus. HIT test negative. BPPV suspected.
Assessment: Benign paroxysmal positional vertigo (BPPV). Crystals in vestibular system shifted. Not consistent with brain tumour.
Plan: Epley manoeuvre to be performed via thuisarts.nl. Instructions to be sent. Physiotherapist can also perform manoeuvre. Patient to try manoeuvre at home. Follow-up to be scheduled.
